instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS: What is PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS? Power rail on 820-2850 logic board for the GPU framebuffer, that is often underpowered and intermittent because of a dying C9560 capacitor that must be replaced on this model to avoid black screen & kernel panics..
definitions.PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R: What is PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R? Power rail on 820-2850 logic board for the GPU framebuffer, that is often underpowered and intermittent because of a dying C9560 capacitor that must be replaced on this model to avoid black screen & kernel panics..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but no chime and no video.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no visible water damage.  Has visible prior repair near camera connector. Drop damage maybe.

Has green light, charges, turns on and fans spin.  Screen never turns on and no chime.  Nothing on external monitor.

No beep with RAM out.

These voltages are out of spec:

<SIGNAL>PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 1.34v (should be 1.8v)
<SIGNAL>PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R</SIGNAL> = 1.35v (should be 1.8v)
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> = 0.911v (should be 1.0v)
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0.81 (should be 1.25v)
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX</SIGNAL> = 0.87v (should be 1.05v)
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_VCAP0</SIGNAL> = 0.8v (should be 1.25v)
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_VCAP1</SIGNAL> = 0.8v (should be 1.25v)
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_VCAP2</SIGNAL> = 1.0v (should be 1.25v)

Any good ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but no chime and no video.
threads.message: Anyone?  The board looks OK under a microscope...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but no chime and no video.
threads.message: USB mouse lighting up when plugged in?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but no chime and no video.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 21658"]USB mouse lighting up when plugged in?[/QUOTE]

No sir, it does not.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on but no chime and no video.
threads.message: Could be anything. Inspect board for missing/damaged parts. Find out history of the board.
